favourite.article: What a song! Years ago I wept my heart through all the four stanzas sung to the blessed old tune. I had arrived late at my church's weekly Monday Bible study. The treacherous Lagos traffic did me in. Meanwhile I had been mourning my confinement to my secular employment in a finance company that paid fine salary but sucked all time and strength from me. I knew God had called me but I couldn't leave because of a pending fraud case in which I was my company's star witness. Barely two minutes after I stepped into church and joined the proceedings the choir stepped out and struck this song. My heart and head exploded in waves of anguish. Every word of the song and the heavenly presence were like a thousand jabs on my soul. The choir must have prayed much. And then, the old tune...(Please, I will have nothing of the often light-hearted "new tune"). The joy is that I found my release months later. That was 1990. I'm still joyfully engaged in my Saviour's service today. Yesterday, the soloist sang this song and brought back old memories... Apologies for my rather long comment.

I will be graduating from school in just a few weeks, and my prayer is not to be one who would find comfort in the things that soon must pass away, but rather experience joy each day in having all things In JESUS. Lord, may we not live a single day without You!

I really appreciate how some of our lovely hymns have been given new tunes. My choir sang 'If I Gained the World' today at church. The flavor was so enthusing and refreshing. I had my first degree in music. I do compositions, record them on CDs and they've been very inspirational to the body of Christ. Can I pick some of your new tunes and record them at the studio to bless some souls? Will be ready for any terms and conditions. Many thanks

Oh what emptiness without the Savior. In Him I have everything, outside of Him I have nothing! This song really echoes song 600 "My God, my Portion and my Love" in the hymnal. Let others grasp in ALL the shore, but just grant me the visits of Your grace, and I would desire no more. Sweet song that reminds me of the Lord's love and mercy :) Lord we give You our whole being to love You!

I had a recent experience that led me to this point.... I just consecrate my whole being, life, future, family, and even going on in Your recovery to You dear Lord for the preparation of Your Bride!!! He takes care of all our needs. I will not boast or brag but as I put the Lord first there is a huge blessing. My deep consideration is that I have all I need because I/we have the Lord and He is in fact all we need. Only He can satisfy eternally. This hymn reminds me that I am not for this world with all of its vain pursuits and attractions. I've been caught and am constrained through the most lovely One!!! Lord Jesus I do love You my dear Master, Husband, Friend, God, my all in all.... Amen!!!

I love the old song version of "If I gained the world" but cannot find it anywhere. Old or new, I don't like this new version which sounds nothing like the original. What's wrong with the old version that someone has to update it to some contemporary stuff. The old beauty was in the old song.
Without Christ, life is completely meaningless.
Oh Lord Jesus, to live in You is only gain. To pursue You is to gain. May our hearts be intertwined with Your unfailing love, day by day and moment by moment.

Oh Lord Jesus, only You can satisfy us! I don't want to go a day without You! Not one! Our true satisfaction is not gaining the things of this world, but gaining YOU! May we gain You more and You gain us more!
O what emptiness without the Savior. This song is the song that I can't forget in my training in PTO...
Blessed song. Thanks for the lyrics. May it continue to touch others.

Nothing in this world can compare to Our Lord Jesus Christ. Everything we need is in Jesus Himself, because all that we seen in this world are only shadow, CHRIST is the reality, and real satisfaction, Oh the Joy of having all in Jesus.
Oh Lord Jesus I love You.

Whenever I have time to listen to this song, it always reminds me that He is everything to us. All the riches, worldly pleasures can never satisfy me, all are just vanity of vanities. PTL! that He keeps on reminding us, O how we need to turn to Him.

Whenever I have the opportunity to listen to this song, it has a property of breaking and giving me a renewed focus about the Lord. If I gained the world but lost my Savior is rather an endless tragedy that can happen to our world. What can a man give in exchange for his soul.

This song really touched the depths of my hardened heart. I was at the point of questioning whether I could continue my pursuit of the Lord, hopeless and disillusioned by everything the world had to offer. I broke down in tears upon hearing the song and applying the words to my own situation. I realize that God has a plan and the world is just a distraction, having the potential to hinder your spiritual growth. Praise Him for allowing us to be humbled and brought back to Him!
If you still think that you can encounter real pleasure in someone else, just consider your life and listen to this song!

When I heard this song it remind me about the Lord and the world. In my experience many times I love the world most especially when I look the needs of my family. But the Lord's mercy is all the time and the grace is sufficient for us. The Lord renews my mind and I want to declare to all that I love the Lord Jesus and not the world nor the things of the world. Lord Jesus I really love You. I may change in everything Lord but I never change in Loving YOU.
I really enjoyed this song. It's very touching and I find myself humming it all the time! The Lord is worth more than all the worldly riches and love. Praise Him!
Wow, very refreshing. I just fall in love with the Lord Jesus anew!

Nothing can be compared to have everything in Jesus, Lord when we have You we have everything.
O the joy of having all in Jesus! What a balm the broken heart to heal! Ne'er a sin so great, but He'll forgive it, Nor a sorrow that He does not feel! If I have but Jesus, only Jesus, Nothing else in all the world besideâ€” O then everything is mine in Jesus; For my needs and more He will provide.

My 15 yr old said "Mom, you really need to learn some new songs...". "Ok, you teach me then?" "Ummm... here is a good one! I will teach you more after you are done with this one." ... "Mom, did you do anything with the song I gave you yesterday?"

Lord,I just love You very very much. O what emptiness without the Savior... We don't have this song in Armenian but I hope we'll soon translate it. It touched me very very much! May the Lord bless you!

4.O the joy of having all in Jesus! What a balm the broken heart to heal! Ne'er a sin so great, but He'll forgive it, Nor a sorrow that He does not feel! If I have but Jesus, only Jesus, Nothing else in all the world besideâ€” O then everything is mine in Jesus; For my needs and more He will provide.
I am 14 yrs. old and I remember listening to this hymn in the 6th grade conference. And I remember I wanted to cry because I have taken the Lord for granted and at times, I still do. But praise the Lord He is in us! Praise the Lord He's by our side.... Lord through big or small I need You!
I consecrate myself to You! Gain my heart, Lord. Use me to build up Your church and Body! Help me be a grace finder. Help me be an ark builder. Help me be an age turner! I fully open to You Lord! My heart is an open door and I'd like You to come inside!

Thank You Lord Jesus that You gave mercy to us. That we might know that You are all our riches. Thank You Lord that You showed us that we would not be saved if we love this world. O the joy of having all in Jesus! Lord, whenever we have problems, You are there to be our comfort, our solace. We have peace every time we touch Your presence.

I already know this song before when I serve the teenagers, but I don't have a deep feeling, I just like the music... but this time, I know what the writer feel when he wrote this song. The Lord enlightened me through the situation that He arranged, that's nothing can compare with God's presence... how we suffered without it... Oh Lord Jesus, my Savior, You know that I still love You...

I got this song when I was in the Full Time Training in Indonesia. I was really touched by the Lord and renewed my concecration upon Him. Yes, I must lose the world to gain the Lord more and more. Ich liebe Dich, Herr!!

I love this song because it remind me about the Lord and world. by the Lord's mercy and grace, I declare to all that I love the Lord Jesus and not the world nor the things of the world. The gospels remind me that we cannot serve the two master. I would rather choose the Lord because everything in world is temporal, refuse, dung, and are just vanity. May all the young people in the Lord's recovery may see this vision. We are for the Lord's recovery. The Lord be with you all saints. Amen!!!

This is one of my favorite song, because the the moment I heard this it reminds me that nothing in this world can satisfy us but the Lord Jesus only, only Jesus! Praise the Lord, that Jesus Christ is our satisfaction! and as young people , we should not lose the Savior rather, we should gained the Lord and lose the world. In this way we are being preserved by Christ Jesus!! Oh Hallelujah!!
Thank the Lord that we have received Him, and He is the One who is worthy to save us. Amen.

Lord Jesus You alone can satisfy me. You alone can fill me. Lord Jesus, I know I won't be able to thank You enough for loving me so much, so marvelous, so unconditional! Lord praise be Your Name forever! Amen!

"O the joy of having all in Jesus! What a balm the broken heart to heal! Ne'er a sin so great, but He'll forgive it, Nor a sorrow that He does not feel! If I have but Jesus, only Jesus, Nothing else in all the world besideâ€” O then everything is mine in Jesus; For my needs and more He will provide."
Thank the Lord that we desire no more when we fully gain HIM..

I remember something about how the poor are blessed because they have no reason to turn to the world and no distraction from Jesus. I feel like the more I lose of the world each day, the more I gain of Jesus, and when the day comes that I overcome this entire age, then I will be able to say that I have everything in my Abba Father Jesus

"If I have but Jesus, only Jesus, Nothing else in all the world besideâ€” O then everything is mine in Jesus; For my needs and more He will provide." Oh Lord Jesus, you are our everything! we are those who follow you wherever you go. My eyes wants to see only You, my heart wants to love only You! I dont want anything else, but YOU!
I love this song because it reminds that everything is vanity without God. Even if we own the entire world but without Him, everything is useless. Christ is the most precious One on earth..
We praise the Lord for enlightening us that life will just be worth living if we have Him. Hallelujah!
We cannot compare all earthly pleasures with a moment of Christ-filled life! Hallelujah!

Oh how need to gain the Lord and not this world. If we gain this world and lost our Savior we dont know if our life is worth living for a day. Because only in Him and to Him we live our life worth living. We find our rest and comfort in Him who will never pass away unlike many things in this world that will pass away...Oh Lord Jesus...May we gain the Lord, saints...

Praise the Lord we had such a Wonderful Savior!!
Nothing can satisfy our lives without Him. Every day we're living with is not meaningful, when we don't enjoy our Savior!! The world is not worthy to have us!!
Our lives will be of no worth when we don't have Him!! All things are just in vain if we don't have Him. Nothing will be worth comparing with a Christ- filled life!!

Wow...what a song. It was very timely to hear it just now. I had never heard it before. I was distracted by many things...but now I have spontaneously been turned to look at Christ. Yes...It would be an excellent song to pray everyday. May the Lord have mercy on all of us to appreciate all that He has done for us. And that spinning our wheels to do this and to do that is not the goal...but Christ gaining us inwardly is. Oh Lord, forgive me for all the time I wasted today and have mercy on me to redeem the time lost. There is no other joy greater than You.

Oh Lord! This hymn really touched me & really reminded me that all things are just vanity if it is not of God! Often we are occupied with other things and our first love is no longer for the Lord. The Lord doesn't just want our first place, He wants our second place, third place, OUR WHOLE BEING!

Oh how we need to praise the Lord! I really enjoyed this hymn because as a young person, you still have a lot of things to go through and experience. There's so much things happening around us. At times, you are so busy with your things, it ends up that we don't really enjoy the Lord. But Hallelujah! This song was such a reminder for me! Even if I gained everything in the world but lost the Savior, there is no meaning in our lives! This hymn should be a daily reminder to us! We need to live by the Lord each and every day! He is all in all!
"What a joy of having all in Jesus" it's really a joy of having Him in our life... I don't want anything...I just want to gain more of Him day by day...OH LORD JESUS... AMEN
I'm so touch of this song, really if we gained the world and lost the Saviour life is so meaningless. Praise the Lord that He gained us already through His grace we're saved. AMEN!!!

This song really means a lot to me, because as a young person there is so much you can become caught up in. Then the reality hits you and you finally see that If I was to gain the whole world, but loose the Lord, it would be for naught. Praise the Lord, let's bring His kingdom back!

"O what emptiness without the Savior!" That's really true. All things are void, false. Only God is real; He fills all in all. "O the joy of having all in Jesus!" What a joy! When we have Jesus, we have all things!

I like this song because throughout my experience, I realize that nothing in this world is more worthy than our Lord, Jesus Christ. He can satisfy our every need. Also through out my experience, I notice that it is not worthy to gain the world, but lost the Savior. No matter what we do in this world. They all end up with an empty feeling inside us. Only Christ can satisfy this hunger. Once we receive Christ as our Savior, it all leads to the satisfaction, joyful, sweet feeling.
